entry.title: Where Transcendental Numbers Hide in Everyday Math
entry.content: The transcendental number π is as familiar as it is ubiquitous, but how does Euler’s number e transcend the ordinary?

entry.title: How Tadayuki Watanabe Disproved a Major Conjecture About Spheres
entry.content: Watanabe invented a new way of distinguishing shapes on his way to solving the last open case of the Smale conjecture, a central question in topology about symmetries of the sphere.

entry.title: How Wavelets Allow Researchers to Transform, and Understand, Data
entry.content: Built upon the ubiquitous Fourier transform, the mathematical tools known as wavelets allow unprecedented analysis and understanding of continuous signals.

entry.title: Mathematicians Prove Melting Ice Stays Smooth
entry.content: After decades of effort, mathematicians now have a complete understanding of the complicated equations that model the motion of free boundaries, like the one between ice and water.
